title: To the people who keep banning Aurelion Sol because of Worlds
body:
Worlds is played on patch 6.18, it is currently patch 6.20. In patch 6.19, Sol received some sizable nerfs that hurt his early game and made him a lot weaker. So, please, stop banning Sol because he is popular at worlds, because that version of Sol is much stronger than the one in live servers.

Sincerely, a wannabe Sol main.

replies.body:
Honestly, i think this version is actually stronger. The early damage still is good, his manacosts are lower **and you don't need to built up escape velocity in order to fly**, which gives you musch more acces to your mobillitytool.
Also, the lategame has been straight buffed.

I still wouldn't ban sol though cause he has a lowish playrate, needs an experienced player to be that strong and requires teamcoordination, so the chances that you face an actually scary sol are rather low.
yeah he got stronger and that's why he dropped 6% in win ratio.
9% according to champion.gg

>Also, the lategame has been straight buffed.

LOL 8 base damage increase on W

Lategame so much stronger!!
aswell as reduced manacosts and easier to acces Fly-mode

to people scared of syndra because worlds...

its the top players in the world playing her, not the bronzies/silvers you're with
I remembered when it used to take actual skill to play syndra

> [{quoted}](name=God of Ascension,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hlTJ0ZMg,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2016-10-10T19:06:05.574+0000)
>
> I remembered when it used to take actual skill to play syndra

so when was the last time her actual abilites were changed? the only thing that has changed was her passive bonus, by removing the bonus damage on max Q and adding extra balls to W which doesnt even add extra damage to W with multiple balls

Pls tell me the hit box on her w matches her visuals and tell me how even if I dodge all her skill shots her ult 100 to 0 any squishy champ that doesnt build magic resist.

TBH im not even annoyed by her ultimate its her W hitbox and how much it slows is pretty ridiculous.

The carries should buy some mr then, or be out of her threat range.
AP can grab Abyssal, ad champs can grab Maw or Mercurial.

Long ranged champions can also grab cleanse to be a little safer from the max range stun.
On top of that Zhonyas is a good 2nd -3rd item vs her as her whole ult is super delayed and very easy to zhonyas.

I really do hate buying Zhonya's right now though myself.  The loss in AP still feels so brutal.

Of course I do buy it when necessary still.

Her ultimate, the most bullshit thing about Syndra, now consistently does WAY more damage because her spheres have a much longer lifespan.

People aren't complaining about getting killed by a full Syndra combo, people complain about her missing literally every spell but then Ulting you, so you die no matter what.

You realize the W change basically removed her skill floor right? Now any Wood VI scrub can keep up a 7-balls ult indefinitely, not to mention a lane-wide stun. It was a dumb AF change and I hope it gets reverted instead of Syndra getting gutted (sadly not happening).

Sincerely,
     A dedicated Syndra main since last season before she became FotM.
The extra balls on W does make it a lot easier to stun multiple people.
I wonder when people will realize Magic Resist does make a difference. and building more damage items don't make you tankier.

> [{quoted}](name=Zed Kusho,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hlTJ0ZMg,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2016-10-10T19:06:05.574+0000)
>
> I remembered when it used to take actual skill to play syndra

Right?? She was my main, but now she lost her flavor when everyone could play her as good a I could... :(

exactly this is why I dropped zed altogether when they did qss changes etc cause I already knew he was gonna be perma-banned. but now im picking him back up since he is more back to normal, hope the assassin update doesnt fk up the rest of my babies.

To anyone delusional enough to think Syndra is fair to lane against....

She isn't, she hits one stun and you die.  Syndra skill lul.

Fizz bends Syndra over so much, you'd think she was a prostitute.

Zed, Talon, Yasuo annihilate her.

Lux and Xerath out-range her.

Can't killean the Zilean. Or the Kayle.

Kassadin is Kassadin.

Viktor shits on her if you take cleanse for her stun. (Or you can get gud and dodge it)

I can go on if you'd like.

Not to mention that Syndra is easy af to gank early.

But you know, no one was complaining about Syndra until world's came around. I wonder why? Maybe because in the past 20 patches, she's only been above 50% winrate 5 times and has a history of having a negative winrate?

Any half-competent Syndra could do the same thing on her 20+ patches ago and no one was complaining. So tell me, what has changed?

"She hits one stun and you die."
Mid-late game: Lux hits one bind and you die; Annie lands a stun and you die; Veigar lands a stun and you die; Hell, as soon as Fizz hits level 6, if he lands shark, you die.

Not to mention all the burst mage who don't need any CC to do the same amount of damage. 

People who think Sydra is a problem. Lul

> [{quoted}](name=vShobosy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hlTJ0ZMg,comment-id=000200010000,timestamp=2016-10-11T13:59:30.453+0000)
>
> Fizz bends Syndra over so much, you'd think she was a prodtitute.

you'd think she was a prodtitute.

she was a prodtitute.

prodtitute.

{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}
Typing too hard on phone. Fixed

> [{quoted}](name=vShobosy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hlTJ0ZMg,comment-id=00020001000000000000,timestamp=2016-10-11T14:35:35.517+0000)
>
> Typing too hard on phone. Fixed

Understandable. lol

I love and hate the way people just flock towards builds and champion bans/picks, no creativity or the ability to think for themselves. I'm no God and I'm in silver, I don't play ranked often and just jump into normal games but whenever I see a Sol or a Nidalee I kinda chuckle because you know or you're 99% sure that they can't use them effectively and it'll most likely be an easy game.
Although, that is a bit unfair to the some that have played him since near his release.

I definitely agree, the same goes for champions like Nidalee, Kindred & I guess high skill cap champions in general, they get the nerf hammer and are either gutted or repeatedly nerfed which sucks. I'm a Kindred main and I understand the nerfs that were dealt to her in earlier patches but now she feels clunky, slow and they don't fit into the game so much as before, they sort of stripped them of their identity and playstyle. To do well as Kindred you need a good team, one that is responsive and map aware, along with a good team comp, (something that is much more prevalent in higher Elos).
Agree
He also has a pretty low play rate, and it's unlikely you'd see him in game anyway. Most people still don't really get how to play him.
I don't have enough IP to play him because he is expensive as fuck and this game is boring af. js. It's hard to play him when he is 112342314123849 IP and ranked is full of cancer.

> [{quoted}](name=Blast Deadlift,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hlTJ0ZMg,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-10-10T17:49:24.161+0000)
>
> I don't have enough IP to play him because he is expensive as fuck and this game is boring af. js. It's hard to play him when he is 112342314123849 IP and ranked is full of cancer.

Then get out.

> [{quoted}](name=Surr20plz,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hlTJ0ZMg,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-10-10T22:02:07.808+0000)
>
> Then get out.

As a new player who just hit level 10, who's champion pool in total is currently {{champion:32}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:22}} {{champion:25}} {{champion:16}} {{champion:19}} , The cost of champions in IP is somewhat daunting.  It does take 50 or so wins to earn a new "good" champion without bonuses, and it's a tall hill to climb.  But to tell someone to quit because they are frustrated is one of the reasons new players don't want to stay.

Just fyi, while it can feel like the 6300 champs are the best, they honestly aren't for 2 big reasons.  1)  They take an absurdly long time to farm up unless you are a super consistent player and there is no guarantee you will enjoy them.  2) They tend to be harder to learn and play for new players, early on you should focus on general game mechanics rather than a specific champion's mechanics.  

There are plenty of powerful champs that are much cheaper.  If you really are set on a 6300 champ then a) play them a bunch when they are free first, b)  don't pick an assassin because their rework is coming up and c) don't pick one of the super popular champs at worlds just because they are strong because they might get some pretty sizable nerfs.

Just some recommendations from someone who went through all that.

> [{quoted}](name=Fondling Gems,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hlTJ0ZMg,comment-id=00000000000000000001,timestamp=2016-10-11T23:07:16.667+0000)
>
> Just fyi, while it can feel like the 6300 champs are the best, they honestly aren't for 2 big reasons.  1)  They take an absurdly long time to farm up unless you are a super consistent player and there is no guarantee you will enjoy them.  2) They tend to be harder to learn and play for new players, early on you should focus on general game mechanics rather than a specific champion's mechanics.  
> 
> There are plenty of powerful champs that are much cheaper.  If you really are set on a 6300 champ then a) play them a bunch when they are free first, b)  don't pick an assassin because their rework is coming up and c) don't pick one of the super popular champs at worlds just because they are strong because they might get some pretty sizable nerfs.
> 
> Just some recommendations from someone who went through all that.

I've been studying for Jungle and Support (mostly Support), and most of the champions that seem popular are all 6300's with the exception of Nidalee.  Bard, Braum, Thresh, Elise, ect. are all 6300's.  I am honestly buying 450 and 1350 champs as I acquire the IP and hoping for good roles out of any boxes I acquire.  :)

2 of my favourite supports (I am also a sup main) are:
Taric - 1350
Nautilus - 4800
Naut can also jg and they are both in a good, strong position right now.  They are also currently on free week if you want to try them.

Other strong but cheap supports include:
Sona - 1350
Morgana - 1350
Janna - 1350
Karma - 3150

Those are just my general recommendations that cover pretty much every type of support.
Naut will teach you a ton about peel and Engage.
Sona will teach you some micromanagement and is really strong when learning the game.
Karma is a strong poke/utility support that can carry games. (If you enjoy her try mid lane more)
Janna is the queen of kite/passive laning phases.
Morgana is all about making picks and learning to use abilities on allies.

Playing some of them will give you a stronger idea of which types of supports you want to aim for.

The Taric recommendation is because I main Taric.  TBF he is also just good right now and not likely to change much.  Pretty easy to pick up and does a lot of unique things that you don't find on other supports.

------------------

Not a big jungler but I will pass on what I know.  I would avoid elise/nid because any champion with 2 sets of abilities is very hard to pick up, let alone do well with.  If you want to play a jgler like them I suggest Evelynn, although they play very differently.  AP assassin jglers are kinda their own niche and have a very different feel to them than other champions.  I would definitely play them a bit on free week or play AP Eve/Full AP Gragas before buying them.  They are very hard to pick up and get changed a lot.

Other than that some good cheaper jglers are:
Nautilus - 4800 (Hi again)
Mundo - 1350 (although more common top)
Udyr/Jax/Shyvana - 1350 (Farm kings/Queen)
Evelynn - 1350 (AP assassin)
Sejuani - 4800 (Teamfight Tank)

I left 450 champs off both these lists since you said you wanted them anyways.  Anyways, other than Evelynn I don't see any of those jglers shifting much anytime soon, and Eve is just there is case you are set on Nid/Elise/Diana and they aren't on free week.  

I tried to keep both my lists to slightly lower maintenance champions who are unlikely to shift much and are good for learning different game mechanics.  If you have more specific interests (The type of support you like to play the most for example) I would be happy to write up a more comprehensive list of the pros and cons of the different champs that fit that.  Although my jgler knowledge is far from great.  Always happy to help though! 

Good Luck on the Rift!

> [{quoted}](name=Fondling Gems,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hlTJ0ZMg,comment-id=0000000000000000000100000000,timestamp=2016-10-12T02:23:43.479+0000)

If you have more specific interests (The type of support you like to play the most for example) I would be happy to write up a more comprehensive list of the pros and cons of the different champs that fit that.  Although my jgler knowledge is far from great.  Always happy to help though! 
> 
> Good Luck on the Rift!

I actually already own Morgana (she was my second champion) because I drew her in an ARAM game and really enjoyed playing her.  I would even consider her my main.  I've tried Braum and really liked his skillset also.  I'll be giving Nautilus and Taric a try for sure.  It seems that putting Support primary always lands me that role, so I'm thinking I can earn enough IP trying to master the champions I have while I save up for others.  I'm also finding that non-squishy Supports are helpful while I go through the growing pains of facechecking bushes to lay down wards.  :o

My knowledge of Support would be okay for someone as new as I am.  I'm big on Vision Control, and thanks to other MOBA's, I have a decent understanding of pings and using the minimap to my advantage.  

Jungle is a different issue.  I understand the paths, buffs, and objectives to a basic extent (Thank you Youtube!), but when to gank, how to see it, ect., are still difficult for me to determine.  I suppose experience and further study will help me clear the fog.

League is a much different MOBA than DOTA, D&T, and HOTS are.  I'm just thankful that the core mechanical skills are largely the same.  But even if I knew everything, I would never stop trying to learn.  It's the nature of the beast.  :)

Current Supports: {{champion:1}} {{champion:25}} {{champion:16}}   Next Target: {{champion:37}} 
Current Junglers: (Laugh if you must!) {{champion:32}} {{champion:19}}   Next Target: {{champion:76}} 

These are subject to change as I learn new things, of course.  Thank you so much for your input!

Yeah, I would definitely try out a tank support.  Naut is my personal favourite (Other than Taric of course) because 3 of his abilities are CC, his passive is CC, he has engage, escape, some of the strongest aoe peel in the game, good damage, consistent dps, and has (in a realistic game) the largest shield in the game.  Serpahs, 25 stack mejai + 4 deathcap Janna shield does not count lol.  

He is just super consistent and kindof a more lockdown version of Braum.  Less blocking for your ally, more permastunning your enemy.

Leona is also a good thing to keep in mind.  She is the epitome of a diver support, although I prefer Naut.

--------------------

Like I said, be careful of Nid.  She has a powerful jg clear but it is heavily dependent on knowing exactly how her clear works.  Her ganks are also very hard to pull off because she needs to land one of the thinnest skillshots in the game, and it isn't even that fast.  Having to remember the cds of 3 abilities you can't see at the same time just adds to the difficulty.  While I say go for it if that is what you want I just wanna warn you that she is very time based, she doesn't have the luxury of trying over and over for good ganks, she has to be there and get the kills to snowball.  If you are still trying to figure out when to gank then you are gonna have a lot of trouble succeeding on her.

But you can definitely learn a lot from nid if you pay attention.

Anyways, I am just here to give advice, ominous warnings, and moan about the beautiful beast that is Taric.  Since you have some goals in mind just shoot me a message if you ever need advice, whether it be game, champion, or just generally want someone to chat with.

> [{quoted}](name=Fondling Gems,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hlTJ0ZMg,comment-id=000000000000000000010000000000000000,timestamp=2016-10-12T03:31:11.148+0000)

I just gave Taric a run in a custom game trying to support an Intermediate Bot (it's just not the same), and I like his kit too.  The only reason Sona was next on my list was her kit seems to be the most like those that I mained in other MOBA's.  Going to give Nautilus a run now, see how he plays out.  But Taric has become my next Support Target.  :)

I targeted Nidalee because she seems to be the only other Jungler aside from Evelynn that isn't a 6300, and from reading the boards and watching some of the worlds games, she is always there.  Her kit looks more difficult than the others, I will admit.  But I seem to be leaning more towards Support at this point.  If I somehow draw Jungle, I can fall back on my two "newbie" junglers for those games, or try out a free rotation when they aren't Nocturne and Gragas.  Warwick is my safe pick because of his sustain.  I don't know why people don't like him other than he can't really gank until 6.  His Attack Speed team buff is pretty amazing.

WW is very strong until you know how to deal with him.  He is often considered one of the really broken champions until you hit around low Silver in which case he is one of the worst champions in the game.  Currently people don't know how to kite well so it is easy to bring them into your blood scent range where you can chase forever.  However after a while there are multiple items, and even a summoner spell, that will stop his ult, after which he is rendered useless.  

That being said he is getting a rework quite soon, I wouldn't surprised to see it coming out before the preseason.  

Amumu is a similar case, except that he is one of the highest winrate jglers up until mid Gold, after which people are better at dealing with him and like WW, he becomes one of the almost unpicked champions in LoL.

> [{quoted}](name=Fondling Gems,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hlTJ0ZMg,comment-id=00000000000000000001000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-10-12T03:55:56.078+0000)
>
> WW is very strong until you know how to deal with him.  He is often considered one of the really broken champions until you hit around low Silver in which case he is one of the worst champions in the game.  Currently people don't know how to kite well so it is easy to bring them into your blood scent range where you can chase forever.  However after a while there are multiple items, and even a summoner spell, that will stop his ult, after which he is rendered useless.  
> 
> That being said he is getting a rework quite soon, I wouldn't surprised to see it coming out before the preseason.  
> 
> Amumu is a similar case, except that he is one of the highest winrate jglers up until mid Gold, after which people are better at dealing with him and like WW, he becomes one of the almost unpicked champions in LoL.

If they are changing the way invisibility works, it stands to reason that Warwick would need a change, because his E seems to call out almost anything under half-health in his range, and if I'm not mistaken, reveal them to everyone.  I haven't gotten the chance to really use him in PvP, and of course, bots aren't going to do anything fun enough to expose such a trick.  I consider them both "get me by" champions until I can afford better ones.  But I will say that clearing is easier with Warwick, and team fighting is easier with Amumu, though neither seem to have the real power of a true Jungler.

But I queue up as Support/Jungle, so I almost never get anything but Support.  I should probably try to broaden my horizons some, but I'm finding a comfort zone in the Support Role.  :)
I've been seeing a lot of him since he appeared in worlds. It's usually feed though.
Maybe people are banning him because they don't want people to play as him just because he was used in worlds, because he got nerfs and sorta sucks right now, so that if anyone plays him they'd feed.
I played him just fine and most of the games I carried. But I think that idea applies to majority of the players who don't main him.
Nobody mains him he's been out for like a week lol
Sol has been out for quite a while...
Sorry I'm super tired. Thought you were replying to a recent post about Ivern.
LOL all good, its late on my end as well

Also stop playing SOl because you saw him at worlds. Just don't. He's currently at 46% winrate according to  Champion.GG. You won't get good results, especially if you're starting out. You will lose your early trades, and you'll feed hard if you try to play him the way he was played before in the early game. You'll also run oom so fast.
And holy fuck is his early game bad.
http://i.makeagif.com/media/6-06-2015/LuKM7T.gif
I personally find him to be extremely obnoxious to play against, and perma slows give me a headache. So you get a ban. (If Riven is already banned.)
